content.question: The student made the standard curve above. Which of the following most likely caused the error in the point the student plotted at <math alttext="0.050 molar C o with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.050</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Co</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: There was distilled water in the cuvette when the student put the standard solution in it.

There were a few drops of the <math alttext="0.100 molar C o 2 with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Co</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> standard solution in the cuvette when the student put the <math alttext="0.050 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.050</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mo>‚Å¢</mo><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> standard solution in it.
The student used a cuvette with a longer path length than the cuvette used for the other standard solutions.

The student did not run a blank between the <math alttext="0.050 molar C o with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.050</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Co</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> solution and the one before it.

content.answer: There was distilled water in the cuvette when the student put the standard solution in it.

skill.text: 2.E: Identify or describe potential sources of experimental error.
